subject: Self Care
title: Resilience as a Skill
description: A quick win: understand Resilience as a Skill.

hook.text: She didn't bounce back because she was special. She bounced back because she'd practiced resilience skills before the crisis hit.

buildup.text: Resilience is not a trait you're born with. It's a set of skills: cognitive flexibility, emotional regulation, and social support.

discovery.text: The Penn Resilience Program showed resilience can be taught. Trained participants had fewer depression symptoms for two years.

twist.text: Resilience doesn't mean not suffering. It means suffering and recovering. The pain is real. The comeback is trainable.

climax.text: Build resilience before you need it: nurture relationships, practice optimism, exercise regularly, and learn to reframe setbacks.

punchline.text: Resilience is a skill, not a gene. Train it before the storm arrives.

quiz.question: What did the Penn Resilience Program demonstrate?
options: Resilience skills can be trained and reduce depression symptoms long-term
Only naturally resilient people benefit from training
